title: BERTScore Architecture

definitions.BERTScore: A metric used to evaluate the quality of text by comparing the similarity of embeddings between a reference and a candidate sentence using BERT embeddings.

summary: The slide presents the BERTScore architecture, a metric for evaluating text quality using BERT embeddings. It includes a step-by-step process of baseline rescaling, contextual embedding, pairwise cosine similarity, and maximum similarity. An optional importance weighting is also mentioned, with a formula for calculating the BERT score.
